STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 19, 2020
Darnell Britt
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
RE: License #: CB820315857
Community Care Organization
18688 Joann
Detroit, MI 48205
Dear Mr. Britt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 14, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or IMSEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure
Kendra Washington
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of the nine updated services plans reviewed contained late
service plans. One was late by sixty- two days and one was
late by two days.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth
and the social service worker. The contract shall be
reviewed and updated at least once every 90 calendar days
and a copy provided to the youth.
One of three Independent Living Youth case records reviewed,
one was missing updated contracts for every 90 calendar days.
The youth last contract review was dated April 20, 2018.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS
MiSACWIS
(Commitment
22)
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated child
welfare information system (MiSACWIS) which will be the
primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
4

One of three case records reviewed, one did not upload the youth Family
Team Meeting minutes into MiSACWIS. One case medical documentation
was not uploaded.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2018 AND INTERIM 2019
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development – Parents and youth
FOM 722-08C over 14 years old.
Page 2
Upon completion of the parent agency treatment plan and
service agreement, the parent is given a copy for review.
Foster Care Workers need to ensure the parent understands
all areas within the agreement. Parent and youth age 14 and
older must sign the PATP.
Four of nine PATP reviewed, four were signed by the youth but
the boxes were not checked and the report was not dated
indicating that the youth participated and agreed with the
development of the plan.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following area:
DHHS IL+ Credentials-Staff Training and Qualifications-Weekly
Contract Oct 17: Documentation
2.8.a.12 page 10
The ILP Coach:
e) Must complete a weekly ILP log documenting actions and
tasks related to a specific goal or outcome along with hours
spent with each child.
5

Agency IL skill tracking forms in hard file though not uploaded in MiSACWIS. It is
recommended that all case related information be uploaded into MiSACWIS.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
A corrective action plan was submitted for the March 28, 2019 Interim Inspection. It
successfully addressed the following as one repeat citations is noted: Rule
400.12212 (3,d) Personnel record, R400.12509 (3) Independent Living record, ISEP
4.22 MiSACWIS which is a repeat from renewal 2018 and interim 2019 and DHHS
policy FOM 722-6B.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Community Care
Organization facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
01/18/2020
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
January 21, 2020
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
